subject: Cohort Learning in the Age of AI: Driving Alignment, Connection, and Impact In Times of Change
body:
Delve into the power of cohort learning.
View this email  in your browser
Almost everyone already uses generative artificial intelligence (AI) at work, but most people are apprehensive about the technology’s impact on their professional and personal lives. While generative AI reduces repetitive tasks, it also makes life at work more isolated. Join this energetic conversation on how cohort learning can help address the challenge of technological disruption by bringing together the best possible content with a rich community of deliberate practice.
During this session
 of the Training Industry Leader Talk, Cohort-Based Learning: Why It Works and How to Make It Work For You, attendees will walk away with insights on:
How to use cohort-based learning to foster organizational alignment and connectedness. 
Why employees seek community involvement during times of uncertainty. 
The benefits of using cohort-based learning to convey complex concepts.
Approaches learning teams can take to strengthen weak ties between employees, customers, partners and communities.
Register now
August 24, 2023 | 11 a.m. - 4 p.m. ET
Register now to attend this session at 12:00 p.m. and any other session during the Training Industry Leader Talk. Can’t attend the live event? Register anyway, and watch the recording when it is available.

subject: LinkedIn Live Today 👔 The Need for Male Allies: The Journey to Better Together
body:
Join us TODAY at 1PM ET for our a conversation with Better Man Movement Founder, Ray Arata and Vice President at Capgemini, Joe Rafter.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Join us 
TODAY
 at 
1:00 p.m ET
 on LinkedIn for a conversation with Ray Arata, Founder of the Better Man Movement, Joe Rafter, Vice President at Capgemini, and Jennifer Brown to discuss the upcoming Better Together Conference. 
 
We'll discuss Joe's participation in the very first Better Man Conference and what made him an early adopter of the movement, toxic masculinity, the need for male allyship, and the evolution of the Better Man Conference to the Better Together Conference. 
 
Please feel free to bring any questions you may have about the new conference this year!
 
We hope to see you there.
 
Register Here
 
Virtual Better Together Conference
October 18th and 19th
 
The 
Better Together
 
Conference
,
 is an event for leaders who are eager to step into their allyship to create inclusive workplaces and for those who may be uncertain of where they fit into the inclusion equation. Presented in partnership by The Better Man Movement and Jennifer Brown Consulting, our goal is help activate everyone, no matter where they are on their learning journey, to be a part of the conversation.
 
Many are striving to build competence, and confidence, to step up, and speak up, but are afraid to say the wrong thing, feeling guilty or even targeted and blamed as the problem. It has become more difficult than ever to practice the imperfect art of allyship - however we identify, because there are few spaces where we can return to the building blocks of inclusion - places where we can deepen our self-awareness, analyze how trust is built, unearth our story, and practice both sharing and listening.
 
This conference is a series of conversations and workshops aimed to foster learning, connection, trust, and empathy, with the intent of articulating a vision for true partnership that includes and enlists 
all of us
.
 
Early bird ends 
TOMOROROW August 15th at
 11:59 pm - secure your tickets while this special lasts.
Secure Your Seat
 
Warmest Regards,
 
Jennifer Brown
CEO & Founder, 
Jennifer Brown Consulting
Author, 
Inclusion
, 
How to Be an Inclusive Leader
, and 
Beyond Diversity
Host, 
The Will To Change
 Podcast
 
Follow me on 
LinkedIn
,

,

, and 
Facebook
Connect with Us

subject: Training Needs Assessment Resources for the Learning Leader
body:
Master the skill training managers rate as the most difficult.
View this email in your browser
.
Master Critical
Skills With Training
Industry Resources
Courses to Close Your Skill Gaps
4 Steps to Needs Analysis
Achieve Targeted Upskilling. Close Skills Gaps.
According to Training Industry 
research
, needs assessment is one of the most difficult responsibilities of a training manager, with only 10% of training professionals indicating that they excel in it. But, there's many incentives to master this responsibility: Those who rate themselves as excellent at needs assessment report salaries that average more than $30K higher than those who rate themselves as only average.
Training Industry provides resources that will help you master the responsibility that training managers rate as one of the most difficult, and pave the way for you to transform your L&D department into a high-performing training function.
needs analysis
/nēdz • əˈnæl.ə.sɪs/ 
noun
A formal, systematic process of identifying and evaluating training that should be done, or specific needs of an individual or group of employees, customers, suppliers, etc. Needs are often referred to as “gaps,” or the difference between what is currently done and what should be performed. Also referred to as a “gap analysis,” or “needs assessment.”
 
QUICKLY DEVELOP YOUR
NEEDS ANALYSIS SAVVY
Conducting a thorough and effective training needs assessment is the 
only way 
to ensure that you are directing your time and resources toward what your organization really needs. Training Industry's 
Needs Assessment Certificate
 will equip you with the skills to conduct your analysis like a pro, and finally stop wasting time and resources on training that doesn't address real issues. Click below to learn more or view the 
upcoming session
 happening September 13-14.
LEARN MORE
 
GET THE PROJECT
PLANNING CHECKLIST
Great training starts with a robust needs assessment that highlights skills gaps and, with them, learning opportunities to close them. When considering potential solutions, conducting an effective training needs assessment should be your top priority: That’s why we created a free step-by-step checklist to assist you alongside your needs assessment journey. Don’t let your training needs assessment fears hold you back from delivering great training.
LEARN MORE
 
Learning Leader or Undercover Detective?
Tune into episode 54 of the Business of Learning podcast to learn how learning leaders can channel their undercover detective persona and identify true learning needs. 
Listen Now >>
4 Steps to Conduct an Effective Training Needs Analysis
  
Step 1
Understand Your Desired Outcome.
  
Step 2
Assess Current Performance.
  
Step 3
Identify the Cause of Skills Gaps.
  
Step 4
Determine Future Skills Needed.
Want to see these steps in depth? View the 
infographic
.
 
 
 
Needs Analysis: The 
Most Important
 Best Practice
"Listening to uncover real business problems and needs" is considered the 
single most important 
best practice for great training, with 71%
 
of training professionals rating it as 
"very important."
 Additionally, training professionals who consider this best practice as "very important" tend to come from 
higher performing 
training organizations. 
Great Training Organizations Research
 
Must-Read Articles on Needs Assessment
Successful Upskilling and Reskilling Begins With a Needs Analysis
Needs Assessments for Upskilling and Reskilling
How to Conduct a Learner Needs Analysis
 
PRO TIP: Zeroing In On Needs Analysis For Learning Tech
When considering solutions for your organization's learning technology needs, make sure to first list all platform features, and then categorize features into "need to have," "nice to have" and "not important." This will help you narrow down your options in order to choose a solution that truly meeting organizational needs.
Get More Tips

subject: One month from TODAY: SIETAR USA Saturday Seminar
body:
'Intercultural vs. Inclusion: One Looks Out, the Other Looks In!' - 9-Sept-2023 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
SATURDAY SEMINAR: 
'Intercultural vs. Inclusion: 
One Looks Out, the Other Looks In!'
 
Your Seminar Leader:
Jay Cafferata, MS, CDE
 
 
 
 
September 9, 2023 @ 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM (Eastern)
 
 
 
 
 
Have 
YOU
 registered yet? This educational event is only one month from TODAY!
Don't miss this Saturday Seminar!  
Jay Cafferata
 will focus on how we unknowingly and unfortunately perpetuate racist ideology, colonialism, oppression, and discrimination in the words we use.  We'll be discussing the breakdown in communication between intercultural and inclusion dialogues. When we think about intercultural, we think international, global or worldwide – but when we think about inclusion, we think local, internal and the workplace. Why are we having these different conversations to the same discourse? What is the breakdown between these two seemingly different sets of vocabulary?
This interactive 4-hour session will include videos, polling, and breakout sessions. Participants are encouraged to join using a device that has a camera and a microphone as well as a secondary device like a phone or computer that allows for multiple windows to be open at the same time for the polling.
Participants will discuss and reflect on:
The words we use to describe others
Historical perspectives on these two lexicons
Global vs Local
The direction of impact: who is studying who?
At the conclusion of the presentation, participants will have:
A greater recognition of how inclusion and intercultural fit together.
The basic awareness of how we present ourselves in an environment or culture that is not necessarily our own.
Strategies to be more aware of where we are as professionals.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Registration Fees
$20 for Students
$45 for current SIETAR USA members in good standing
$65 for non-members
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Student-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Your Seminar Leader
Jay Cafferata, MS, CDE
Mr. Cafferata is a well-known speaker and advocate for issues involving Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging. He considers himself a Social Justice Warrior and has spent decades as an advocate for the Sexual and Gender Minority Community. He has over 20 years of experience working with families of children with special needs. He has a master’s degree in communication studies from University of Nevada, Reno. and an associate degree in Deaf Studies from Western Nevada College. Mr. Cafferata is also a Certified Diversity Executive. He can be reached at 
jay@asltraining.com
.

subject: The world of work is constantly evolving—are you on top of DE&I trends?
body:
Here’s a few trends to look out for in the coming year as we continue to build and sustain inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplaces. 
 
 
How can you ensure 
you’re on top of DE&I trends?
INCLUSION 2023
 brings together experts and thousands of HR and DE&I professionals from across industries, so that you can expand your thinking and 
keep pushing positive impact forward in the world of work
. 
Here are a few trends to look out for in the coming year as we continue to build and sustain 
diverse
, 
equitable
 and 
inclusive
 workplaces. 
 
  
 
Data & Technology will be your distinguisher
 
You need to collect data to 
measure the effectiveness of your DE&I strategy
, but data can be used creatively to ensure you hit your goals. Employee surveys can highlight potential social impact initiatives such as volunteer work and sustainability, 
improving culture
 and 
reducing turnover
 in the long term. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve dedicated an entire content track to 
technology & accessibility
 to help you harness the power of technology while remaining cognizant of employee needs, with sessions like 
ChatGPT: Disruptor or Enabler?
 with 
Carol A. Kiburz, SHRM-SCP
. 
  
  
 
Gender identity will continue to take center stage
 
Words matter, and how employees choose to identify is important for mental health and overall office well-being. It’s 
critical
 that leaders take a pulse on how your organization engages with gender diversity and updates forms and surveys to reflect overall awareness. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve tailored sessions around 
optimizing employee well-being
 at every level, with sessions like 
WORDS MATTER: The Case for Inclusive Communication Across Generations
 with 
Joy Johnson-Carruthers
. 
  
  
 
Invest in Leadership
 
Outdated leadership programs will continue to be overhauled and rebuilt to emphasize DE&I strategy and 
maximize employee retention
. Employees are no longer impressed with old-guard leadership tactics—your approach must be 
authentic
 and 
transparent
 in order to build trust and maximize engagement. 
At INCLUSION 2023 we’ve built our programming to 
maximize leadership potential
 and 
invest in DE&I strategy
, with sessions like 
The Three Big Chasms of New Diverse Leadership
 with 
Guillermo Mendoza
. 
  
 
Don’t fall behind on DE&I trends
. Join thousands of your peers and industry experts at 
INCLUSION 2023
 this 
Oct. 30 - Nov. 1
 in 
Savannah, Ga
. Last year this conference sold out so don’t delay and 
secure your seat today
! 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
  
CHECK OUT THIS 
PRECONFERENCE OPPORTUNITY 
  
 
 
 
Inclusive Workplace Culture:
Leading and Sustaining a Culture Transformation
* 
 
John Baldino
 
SHRM-SCP, MSHR, SPHR 
 
Numerous research studies conﬁrm that diverse workforces lead in innovation, productivity and proﬁtability. The key to unlocking these organizational benefits is to...

subject: Are You Prepared for AI in the Workplace?
body:
Learn the risks and benefits of AI with SHRM.
 
 
Despite concerns about 
automation replacing human workers
,
 research shows 
artificial intelligence (AI)
 is most successful when coupled with a human touch. 
Humans are still better suited to jobs that involve data analysis, software development, or creativity and jobs that are less likely to be automated, such as marketing and sales. But the reality is that AI is all around us, and its applications and usage will continue to grow. 
Join SHRM today
 to find out how AI can help you prepare for the future of work and AI's place in it. 
 
 
JOIN NOW
 
 
 
EXCLUSIVE RESOURCES
 
 
 
 
 
 
SHRM People Analytics Specialty Credential
Earn the 
SHRM People Analytics Specialty Credential 
and 
 
begin your journey into the field of people analytics by investigating relevant, real-world business issues and effectively communicating data-supported findings. 
 
 
 
 
ChatGPT and AI in the Workplace Hub Page
 
 
Explore the latest articles
, toolkits and more on utilizing ChatGPT and other forms of AI at work.
 
 
 
 
 
Create Your Own AI Usage Policy
Large corporations are 
increasingly embracing AI
. Learn how to stand out and be a part of a new reality by creating your own usage policy.
 
 
 
 
HR Is Embracing ChatGPT But Still Wary of Risks
According to experts, HR professionals who understand and use ChatGPT and other forms of AI are likely to 
replace HR professionals who don't.

.

Take control of difficult situations at work
 
Work relationships can be hard. Dealing with difficult people can dampen creativity and productivity, degrade decision-making abilities, and cause us to disengage. Take control with the 
Getting Along Toolkit: Practical Techniques for Dealing with Difficult People at Work
. 
 
LEARN MORE
 
 
 
 
In the kit:
 
Ebook: 
Getting Along: How to Work with Anyone
This informative guide, written by workplace expert and HBR podcast host Amy Gallo, provides a practical, evidence-based approach to dealing with difficult people at work. 
 
 
 
 
The Assessment Tool
By answering a few simple questions, you’ll determine which of the 8 types of difficult colleagues you’re most likely dealing with. 
 
 
 
 
Support Tools
You also get additional tools to help you move forward with the recommendations: 
A Tactics Tracker
 so you can know which solutions are most effective.
A Decision Guide
 to help determine whether to escalate the problem.
The Last Resort Tool
 with other steps you may choose to take if all else fails.
 
 
 
 
6 Coaching Podcasts
In each 30-minute podcast, Amy Gallo coaches a professional on how to navigate a real-life situation with a challenging coworker. 
 
 
 
 
The Handbook
Get the most for your toolkit investment with step-by-step guidance on how to use each tool most effectively. 
 
 
This indispensable toolkit will help you navigate your toughest interactions and relationships at work—and build interpersonal resilience in the process.

body:
'Exploring African Culture' w/ Geremie Sawadago ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WEBINAR: 
'Exploring African Culture'
Your Presenter:
Geremie Sawadago, 
HR Manager, World Bank Group
 
 
 
 
September 13, 2023 @ 11:30 AM (Eastern)
 
 
 
 
 
This webinar will explore
 the rich diversity in African cultures and discuss the case for African cultural unity around six shared cultural values, including: 
(1) communication style; (2) individualism/collectivism; (3) power distance; (4) uncertainty avoidance; (5) polychromic use of time; and (6) long term/short term orientation. 
 Participants will further their knowledge, appreciation and understanding of African cultures and learn tips to effectively communicate and interact with Africans in both a professional and personal context. 
 
Registration = FREE for current SIETAR USA members in good standing
 
Registration = $25.00 for nonmembers
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Non-Member-Register 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Geremie Sawadago
Geremie Sawadogo is HR Manager at The World Bank Group in Washington DC.
  
Prior to joining the Bank, Geremie was the Country Director for the US Peace Corps in Benin, and he has also taught education and intercultural communication and directed international education programs at universities and community colleges across the US.
  
Geremie is a published 
author in the areas of intercultural competencies and international education, and he wrote the African cultural assessment tool (AfricanXculture.com) which allows individuals to assess themselves against an African cultural values benchmark. 
 
 
 
About Your Presenter
Geremie Sawadago
Geremie Sawadogo is HR Manager at The World Bank Group in Washington DC.
  
Prior to joining the Bank, Geremie was the Country Director for the US Peace Corps in Benin, and he has also taught education and intercultural communication and directed international education programs at universities and community colleges across the US.
  
Geremie is a published 
author in the areas of intercultural competencies and international education, and he wrote the African cultural assessment tool (AfricanXculture.com) which allows individuals to assess themselves against an African cultural values benchmark.

subject: SIETAR USA Call For Nominations - 2023
body:
Are YOU ready to serve? ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear SIETAR USA Members and Colleagues,
 
 
 
 
 
The SIETAR USA leadership team values diversity in all its forms and is committed to creating and fostering an inclusive environment for all SIETAR USA members. To that end, we are issuing the 
2023 Call for Nominations for the Board of Directors of SIETAR USA
. We encourage all members of our community to participate in the Board of Directors election process to support our efforts to cultivate a culture that embraces and values diversity, equity, and inclusion. 
You may nominate yourself or another member of the organization. Any candidate for Board positions must meet the following criteria in addition to role-specific requirements listed in each position description:
 
 
 
 
1.
     
Possess a strong background and understanding of intercultural communications and/or fields of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB).
 
 
 
 
 
2.
     
Be a member in good standing with SIETAR USA (or willing to become a member).
 
 
 
 
3.
     
Have attended at least one SIETAR USA conference in recent years.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Open Positions
 
There are a total of five (5) board positions open for nominations in 2023:
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
View Open Positions for 2023 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Nominations Process-Details 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
All nominations must be submitted using the form provided (click the 'Submit Nomination' button shown below) NO LATER THAN:
 
Friday, September 1, 2023 
5 PM CST
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Submit Nomination 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We look forward to your responses to this Call for Nominations and your participation in this process! 
Feel free to contact us with any questions at 
boardleadership@sietarusa.org
 or 
admin@sietarusa.org
.
Thank you for supporting SIETAR USA!
